Android fundamentals examples by topic, please open the drawer to explore the topics by example.
Aligns all child views in a single direction vertically (row) or horizontally (column).
The layout in which elements arranges itself relative to its siblings or parent.

It is similar to RelativeLayout in that all views are laid out according to relative positions between sibling views and parent layout, additionally auto-calculates constraints to group elements by forming a chain that allows to arrange view without creating nested layouts.
